ggsnes 0.0.1

Custom color and fill scales

Source: R/infra-palette.R
scale_custom.Rd

Custom coloring and filling functions based on unique color palettes

scale_color_discrete_snes(palette = "test", extend = FALSE, ...)

scale_colour_discrete_snes(palette = "test", extend = FALSE, ...)

scale_fill_discrete_rtistic(palette = "test", extend = FALSE, ...)

scale_color_opinionated_snes(palette = "test", ...)

scale_colour_opinionated_snes(palette = "test", extend = FALSE, ...)

scale_fill_opinionated_rtistic(palette = "test", ...)

scale_color_diverging_rtistic(palette = "test", ...)

scale_colour_diverging_rtistic(palette = "test", ...)

scale_fill_diverging_rtistic(palette = "test", ...)

scale_color_continuous_rtistic(palette = "test", ...)

scale_colour_continuous_rtistic(palette = "test", ...)

scale_fill_continuous_rtistic(palette = "test", ...)

Arguments

palette

Name of color palette
extend

Whether to extend discrete color palette to make sufficient colors for levels needed
...

Additional arguments to be passed to internal scale function

Details

Specific functions include:

  • scale_(color/colour/fill)_discrete_rtisticDiscrete palette with either fixed or dynamically extended number of shades

  • scale_(color/colour/fill)_opinionated_rtisticDiscrete palette with specific values for "good", "bad", and "neutral"

  • scale_(color/colour/fill)_diverging_rtisticContinuous diverging color palette

  • scale_(color/colour/fill)_continuousCOntinuous color palette

References

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Traffic_light
